It is hard to contain those two knights, but it is also true that it is difficult to take the better advantage of them. Nevertheless, I had Bxh2+. After Jf1 (or I can stale the game unless white goes QxR), after the retreat of the dsb mate is threatened, so white must lose a tempo defending it and not attacking. Still, I considered that the check wasn't the right path. I was wrong.
